intro: Olax sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran olax, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Sumatra. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its fruits are capsules that split open to release small, black seeds. Olax sumatrana is often found in lowland and hill forest habitats, where it plays a role in local biodiversity.
